005package edu.wpi.first.math;
006
007import edu.wpi.first.math.geometry.Pose2d;
008import edu.wpi.first.math.numbers.N1;
009import edu.wpi.first.math.numbers.N3;
010import edu.wpi.first.math.numbers.N4;
011import java.util.Random;
012import org.ejml.simple.SimpleMatrix;
013
014@SuppressWarnings("ParameterName")
015public final class StateSpaceUtil {
016  private static Random rand = new Random();
017
018  private StateSpaceUtil() {
019    // Utility class
020  }
021
022  /**
023   * Creates a covariance matrix from the given vector for use with Kalman filters.
024   *
025   * <p>Each element is squared and placed on the covariance matrix diagonal.
026   *
027   * @param <States> Num representing the states of the system.
028   * @param states A Nat representing the states of the system.
029   * @param stdDevs For a Q matrix, its elements are the standard deviations of each state from how
030   *     the model behaves. For an R matrix, its elements are the standard deviations for each
031   *     output measurement.
032   * @return Process noise or measurement noise covariance matrix.
033   */
034  @SuppressWarnings("MethodTypeParameterName")
035  public static <States extends Num> Matrix<States, States> makeCovarianceMatrix(
036      Nat<States> states, Matrix<States, N1> stdDevs) {
037    var result = new Matrix<>(states, states);
038    for (int i = 0; i < states.getNum(); i++) {
039      result.set(i, i, Math.pow(stdDevs.get(i, 0), 2));
040    }
041    return result;
042  }
043
044  /**
045   * Creates a vector of normally distributed white noise with the given noise intensities for each
046   * element.
047   *
048   * @param <N> Num representing the dimensionality of the noise vector to create.
049   * @param stdDevs A matrix whose elements are the standard deviations of each element of the noise
050   *     vector.
051   * @return White noise vector.
052   */
053  public static <N extends Num> Matrix<N, N1> makeWhiteNoiseVector(Matrix<N, N1> stdDevs) {
054    Matrix<N, N1> result = new Matrix<>(new SimpleMatrix(stdDevs.getNumRows(), 1));
055    for (int i = 0; i < stdDevs.getNumRows(); i++) {
056      result.set(i, 0, rand.nextGaussian() * stdDevs.get(i, 0));
057    }
058    return result;
059  }
060
061  /**
062   * Creates a cost matrix from the given vector for use with LQR.
063   *
064   * <p>The cost matrix is constructed using Bryson's rule. The inverse square of each tolerance is
065   * placed on the cost matrix diagonal. If a tolerance is infinity, its cost matrix entry is set to
066   * zero.
067   *
068   * @param <Elements> Nat representing the number of system states or inputs.
069   * @param tolerances An array. For a Q matrix, its elements are the maximum allowed excursions of
070   *     the states from the reference. For an R matrix, its elements are the maximum allowed
071   *     excursions of the control inputs from no actuation.
072   * @return State excursion or control effort cost matrix.
073   */
074  @SuppressWarnings("MethodTypeParameterName")
075  public static <Elements extends Num> Matrix<Elements, Elements> makeCostMatrix(
076      Matrix<Elements, N1> tolerances) {
077    Matrix<Elements, Elements> result =
078        new Matrix<>(new SimpleMatrix(tolerances.getNumRows(), tolerances.getNumRows()));
079    result.fill(0.0);
080
081    for (int i = 0; i < tolerances.getNumRows(); i++) {
082      if (tolerances.get(i, 0) == Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY) {
083        result.set(i, i, 0.0);
084      } else {
085        result.set(i, i, 1.0 / (Math.pow(tolerances.get(i, 0), 2)));
086      }
087    }
088
089    return result;
090  }
091
092  /**
093   * Returns true if (A, B) is a stabilizable pair.
094   *
095   * <p>(A, B) is stabilizable if and only if the uncontrollable eigenvalues of A, if any, have
096   * absolute values less than one, where an eigenvalue is uncontrollable if rank(λI - A, B) %3C n
097   * where n is the number of states.
098   *
099   * @param <States> Num representing the size of A.
100   * @param <Inputs> Num representing the columns of B.
101   * @param A System matrix.
102   * @param B Input matrix.
103   * @return If the system is stabilizable.
104   */
105  @SuppressWarnings("MethodTypeParameterName")
106  public static <States extends Num, Inputs extends Num> boolean isStabilizable(
107      Matrix<States, States> A, Matrix<States, Inputs> B) {
108    return WPIMathJNI.isStabilizable(A.getNumRows(), B.getNumCols(), A.getData(), B.getData());
109  }
110
111  /**
112   * Returns true if (A, C) is a detectable pair.
113   *
114   * <p>(A, C) is detectable if and only if the unobservable eigenvalues of A, if any, have absolute
115   * values less than one, where an eigenvalue is unobservable if rank(λI - A; C) %3C n where n is
116   * the number of states.
117   *
118   * @param <States> Num representing the size of A.
119   * @param <Outputs> Num representing the rows of C.
120   * @param A System matrix.
121   * @param C Output matrix.
122   * @return If the system is detectable.
123   */
124  @SuppressWarnings("MethodTypeParameterName")
125  public static <States extends Num, Outputs extends Num> boolean isDetectable(
126      Matrix<States, States> A, Matrix<Outputs, States> C) {
127    return WPIMathJNI.isStabilizable(
128        A.getNumRows(), C.getNumRows(), A.transpose().getData(), C.transpose().getData());
129  }
130
131  /**
132   * Convert a {@link Pose2d} to a vector of [x, y, theta], where theta is in radians.
133   *
134   * @param pose A pose to convert to a vector.
135   * @return The given pose in vector form, with the third element, theta, in radians.
136   */
137  public static Matrix<N3, N1> poseToVector(Pose2d pose) {
138    return VecBuilder.fill(pose.getX(), pose.getY(), pose.getRotation().getRadians());
139  }
140
141  /**
142   * Clamp the input u to the min and max.
143   *
144   * @param u The input to clamp.
145   * @param umin The minimum input magnitude.
146   * @param umax The maximum input magnitude.
147   * @param <I> The number of inputs.
148   * @return The clamped input.
149   */
150  @SuppressWarnings({"ParameterName", "LocalVariableName"})
151  public static <I extends Num> Matrix<I, N1> clampInputMaxMagnitude(
152      Matrix<I, N1> u, Matrix<I, N1> umin, Matrix<I, N1> umax) {
153    var result = new Matrix<I, N1>(new SimpleMatrix(u.getNumRows(), 1));
154    for (int i = 0; i < u.getNumRows(); i++) {
155      result.set(i, 0, MathUtil.clamp(u.get(i, 0), umin.get(i, 0), umax.get(i, 0)));
156    }
157    return result;
158  }
159
160  /**
161   * Renormalize all inputs if any exceeds the maximum magnitude. Useful for systems such as
162   * differential drivetrains.
163   *
164   * @param u The input vector.
165   * @param maxMagnitude The maximum magnitude any input can have.
166   * @param <I> The number of inputs.
167   * @return The normalizedInput
168   */
169  public static <I extends Num> Matrix<I, N1> desaturateInputVector(
170      Matrix<I, N1> u, double maxMagnitude) {
171    double maxValue = u.maxAbs();
172    boolean isCapped = maxValue > maxMagnitude;
173
174    if (isCapped) {
175      return u.times(maxMagnitude / maxValue);
176    }
177    return u;
178  }
179
180  /**
181   * Convert a {@link Pose2d} to a vector of [x, y, cos(theta), sin(theta)], where theta is in
182   * radians.
183   *
184   * @param pose A pose to convert to a vector.
185   * @return The given pose in as a 4x1 vector of x, y, cos(theta), and sin(theta).
186   */
187  public static Matrix<N4, N1> poseTo4dVector(Pose2d pose) {
188    return VecBuilder.fill(
189        pose.getTranslation().getX(),
190        pose.getTranslation().getY(),
191        pose.getRotation().getCos(),
192        pose.getRotation().getSin());
193  }
194
195  /**
196   * Convert a {@link Pose2d} to a vector of [x, y, theta], where theta is in radians.
197   *
198   * @param pose A pose to convert to a vector.
199   * @return The given pose in vector form, with the third element, theta, in radians.
200   */
201  public static Matrix<N3, N1> poseTo3dVector(Pose2d pose) {
202    return VecBuilder.fill(
203        pose.getTranslation().getX(),
204        pose.getTranslation().getY(),
205        pose.getRotation().getRadians());
206  }
207}
